attributes.description: The measurement accuracy of the fuel quantity sensors, indicating the precision level of fuel level detection.
attributes.name: measurementAccuracy

attributes.description: The interval at which the fuel quantity measurement system updates its readings to ensure near real-time monitoring.
attributes.name: updateInterval

attributes.description: Operating temperature range to ensure reliable sensor performance under various atmospheric conditions.
attributes.name: operatingTemperatureRange

attributes.description: The recommended calibration interval to maintain sensor accuracy over extended flight hours.
attributes.name: sensorCalibrationInterval

designScenario.description: The Fuel Quantity Measurement System is a critical avionics subsystem designed to accurately measure and monitor the fuel levels within an aircraft. It integrates a network of sensor arrays, data acquisition modules, signal processing units, and diagnostic interfaces to deliver reliable fuel quantity data under varying flight conditions. The system supports real-time measurements, redundant sensing, continuous self-diagnosis, and seamless integration with cockpit displays, ensuring both operational safety and maintenance efficiency.
designScenario.name: Fuel Quantity Measurement System

details.description: Collect and process data from multiple fuel tanks via sensor arrays to compute the accurate fuel level in real-time.
Integrate redundant sensor inputs to ensure reliable fuel quantity reporting under all flight conditions.
Maintain a measurement accuracy within ±0.5% across the entire operating range.
Ensure the data update interval does not exceed 500 ms to support timely decision-making by pilots.
Deploy dual or multiple sensor arrays to provide redundancy, ensuring continuous operation even in the case of individual sensor failures.
Incorporate fault detection mechanisms that automatically notify the crew and trigger backup sensor activation.
Design the system with ease of maintenance in mind, allowing for quick calibration and diagnostic self-tests.
Provide a user-friendly maintenance interface for flight crews and technicians to monitor system health and perform routine calibrations.

relationships.description: The Data Acquisition Module is composed of the Fuel Sensor Array which gathers raw fuel quantity data from multiple fuel tanks.
The Signal Processing Unit depends on the Data Acquisition Module to receive digitized sensor data for further analysis.
The Diagnostic and Calibration Module is associated with both the Fuel Sensor Array and the Signal Processing Unit to facilitate system health checks and calibration procedures.
The Diagnostic and Calibration Module is associated with the Signal Processing Unit to continuously monitor and optimize measurement processes.
The Cockpit Display Integration module receives processed fuel quantity data from the Signal Processing Unit, ensuring timely information is available to the flight crew.

systemComponents.description: A network of sensors measuring fuel levels from various tanks, providing raw analog signals that represent fuel quantity.
systemComponents.name: Fuel Sensor Array

subComponents.description: Primary fuel sensor responsible for high-accuracy measurements under nominal conditions.
subComponents.name: Primary Fuel Sensor

subComponents.description: Backup fuel sensor that provides redundancy in the event of primary sensor failure.
subComponents.name: Backup Fuel Sensor

subComponents.description: Reserve fuel sensor monitoring auxiliary tanks to support overall fuel management.
subComponents.name: Reserve Fuel Sensor

systemComponents.description: Module responsible for acquiring analog signals from the sensor array and converting them into digital data for further processing.
systemComponents.name: Data Acquisition Module

systemComponents.description: Unit that processes digitized sensor signals using advanced algorithms to compute the precise fuel quantity.
systemComponents.name: Signal Processing Unit

systemComponents.description: Module that conducts continuous self-diagnostics and calibration, ensuring system reliability and accuracy over time.
systemComponents.name: Diagnostic and Calibration Module

subComponents.description: Subsystem responsible for routine self-testing and health monitoring of the fuel measurement components.
subComponents.name: Self-Test Subsystem

subComponents.description: Subsystem dedicated to calibrating sensor outputs and adjusting measurement parameters as required.
subComponents.name: Calibration Subsystem

systemComponents.description: Interface module that presents the processed fuel quantity data to the cockpit displays for pilot monitoring.
systemComponents.name: Cockpit Display Integration

comments.body: This Block represents the complete Fuel Quantity Measurement System, including its components and interfaces.
